s.text: Phylogenic analyses of both DNA and amino acid sequences were performed using PAUP* [ 23 ] . In this study Cpn 0186 (IncA), and four additional candidate inclusion membrane proteins, Cpn 0284, Cpn 0285, Cpn 0829 and Cpn 0830, were selected as members of an outgroup for analysis.
Variation is also observed within individual family members, both between strains [ 14 ] and, as shown in this report, within individual isolates.
These data were presented at the American Society for Microbiology Meeting, Salt Lake City, May 2002

Relatively little is known about molecular pathogenesis, genetic diversity and adaptive strategy of C. pneumoniae . Although the genomic organization of these independent strains is very similar (over 99.

Relatively little is known about molecular pathogenesis, genetic diversity and adaptive strategy of C. pneumoniae . Although the genomic organization of these independent strains is very similar (over 99.

Genomic analyses have recently revealed a large gene family of 21 polymorphic outer membrane proteins (Pmps) with predicted outer membrane localization in C. pneumoniae [ 7 10 11 ] . The function of this gene family in chlamydial growth and development remains unknown.

Recently, it has been reported that interstrain and intrastrain variation of gene expression and protein productions of pmpG 6 and pmpG 10 are modulated by deletion of tandem repeats in pmpG 6 [ 9 11 ] and variation in the length of polyguanosine tract in pmpG 10 [ 12 13 ] . This evidence suggests that variation may be an important requisite for the function of this gene family in the biology of Chlamydiae .
Variation is also observed within individual family members, both between strains [ 14 ] and, as shown in this report, within individual isolates.

Genomic analyses have recently revealed a large gene family of 21 polymorphic outer membrane proteins (Pmps) with predicted outer membrane localization in C. pneumoniae [ 7 10 11 ] . The function of this gene family in chlamydial growth and development remains unknown.
Homopolymeric cytosine (poly C) tract and the variations of the length of poly C tracts in the Cpn 1054 gene family

Sequence data collected directly from amplification products of several Cpn 1054 family members showed that polymorphisms within the polyC tract were present in all tested family members except Cpn 041 and Cpn 045 (not shown).

The redundant nature of the Cpn 1054 family members is somewhat unusual against the generally reductive evolutionary strategy of the chlamydiae [ 17 ] . There is no evidence that the Cpn 1054 gene family is found outside of C. pneumoniae , and thus the members of the family may be important in the unique biological traits of this species.

Gene products of these paralogous genes contained a unique bi-lobed hydrophobic domain, which is a predictive marker for localization to the inclusion membrane [ 15 ] . In this study, we further characterize this family by examining variation in sequence of the family members both within and among different C. pneumoniae isolates.
The Cpn 1054 gene family consists of 11 C. pneumoniae -specific genes or gene pairs: Cpn 07, 08/09, 010/010.
In some cases (Cpn 007, 124, 126) the hydrophobic domain represents the primary reason the gene is included in the Cpn1054 gene family (Figure 4A,4B; Figure 5).
Therefore, the polyC tract in Cpn 041 and Cpn 045 appear to be conserved among isolates, a result consistent with the data in the genome sequences.
